content: The problem of the quadrature of the circle is the task of constructing a square with the same area as a given circle. This problem has a long history dating back to ancient Greece, where philosophers attempted to solve it with geometry. Hippocrates of Chios was one of the earliest known philosophers who attempted to solve the problem by using moon-shaped figures. However, his method was a dead end. Euclid's "The Elements" is one of the most well-known texts from antiquity that dealt with geometry and has had a lasting impact on Western culture. The book, however, wasn't a textbook as we know it today, but was copied and changed over time, and much of what we know about the book is influenced by late 19th century views. In the "The Elements," Euclid deals with the problem of the quadrature of the circle and the theorem that there are five regular solids.
